class qiskit_vqe_framework.TerminationChecker.LinearFitChecker(buffer_length: int, epsilon: float)¶

Bases: TerminationChecker

Class implementation to check termination of a running optimization, by evaluating the cost function values over several iterations with a linear fit. If the slope of the linear fit is below a certain threshold, its assumed that the optimization terminated (has converged).

__call__(nfev: int, parameters: Sequence[float], value: float, stepsize: int, accepted: bool) → bool¶

Calling the class as a function means to check the termination of the optimization inputs according to the implemented method.

Parameters:

  • nfev – Current number of cost function evaluations

  • parameters – Current optimization parameters

  • value – Current cost function value

  • stepsize – Step size for changing the optimization parameters

  • accepted – Bool flag if the optimization step is accepted by the used optimizer

Returns:

Bool flag if the optimization has terminated (converged).

__eq__(other) → bool¶

Method to compare two LinearFitChecker objects. It compares class instance, epsilon threshold, name, values and buffer length.

Parameters:

other – Other class object that is compared with instace of this class

Returns:

Bool flag which is False if the two objects are not the same and True if they are the same.

__hash__ = None¶
__init__(buffer_length: int, epsilon: float) → None¶
Parameters:

  • buffer_length – Integer number that determines the buffer length. The buffer contains the cost function values of previous optimization steps.

  • epsilon – Threshold for the slope of the linear fit.

Raises:

ValueError – If epsilon is negative.

__repr__()¶

String format of class for output in REPR.

__weakref__¶

list of weak references to the object (if defined)

_check_termination(nfev: int, parameters: Sequence[float], value: float, stepsize: int, accepted: bool) → bool¶

Check if the optimization has terminated (has converged) by performing a linear fit on the cost function values.

Parameters:

  • nfev – Current number of cost function evaluations

  • parameters – Current optimization paramters

  • value – Current cost function value

  • stepsize – Step size for changing the optimization parameters

  • accepted – Bool flag if the optimization step is accepted by the used optimizer

Returns:

Bool flag if the optimization has terminated (converged).

to_dict() → dict¶
Returns:

Deepcopy of the class properties as a dictionary.

class qiskit_vqe_framework.TerminationChecker.RelativeEnergyChecker(buffer_length: int, considered_values_length: int, epsilon: float)¶

Bases: TerminationChecker

Class implementation to check termination of a running optimization, by evaluating the relative change in the cost function values over several iterations.

__call__(nfev: int, parameters: Sequence[float], value: float, stepsize: int, accepted: bool) → bool¶

Calling the class as a function means to check the termination of the optimization inputs according to the implemented method.

Parameters:

  • nfev – Current number of cost function evaluations

  • parameters – Current optimization parameters

  • value – Current cost function value

  • stepsize – Step size for changing the optimization parameters

  • accepted – Bool flag if the optimization step is accepted by the used optimizer

Returns:

Bool flag if the optimization has terminated (converged).

__eq__(other) → bool¶

Method to compare two RelativeEnergyChecker objects. It compares class instance, considered_values_length, epsilon threshold , name, values and buffer length.

Parameters:

other – Other class object that is compared with instace of this class

Returns:

Bool flag which is False if the two objects are not the same and True if they are the same.

__hash__ = None¶
__init__(buffer_length: int, considered_values_length: int, epsilon: float) → None¶
Parameters:

  • buffer_length – Integer number that determines the buffer length. The buffer contains the cost function values of previous optimization steps.

  • considered_values_length – minimal number of values in history buffer to allow calculation of relative energy change

  • epsilon – relative energy change threshold

Raises:

  • ValueError – If epsilon is negative.

  • ValueError – If considered_values_length is not positive or larger than the buffer length.

__repr__()¶

String format of class for output in REPR.

__weakref__¶

list of weak references to the object (if defined)

_calc_relative_change() → Sequence[float]¶

Function to calculate the relative change in the cost function values

Returns:

Relative change in the cost function values

_check_termination(nfev: int, parameters: Sequence[float], value: float, stepsize: int, accepted: bool) → bool¶

Check if the optimization has terminated (has converged) by evaluating the relative change in the cost function values.

Parameters:

  • nfev – Current number of cost function evaluations

  • parameters – Current optimization paramters

  • value – Current cost function value

  • stepsize – Step size for changing the optimization parameters

  • accepted – Bool flag if the optimization step is accepted by the used optimizer

Returns:

Bool flag if the optimization has terminated (converged).

to_dict() → dict¶
Returns:

Deepcopy of the class properties as a dictionary.

class qiskit_vqe_framework.TerminationChecker.TerminationChecker(buffer_length: int, name_str: str)¶

Bases: object

Base class for checking termination of a running optimization. The different methods for checking this are implemented as different classes, which all inherit from this base class.

__call__(nfev: int, parameters: Sequence[float], value: float, stepsize: int, accepted: bool) → bool¶

Calling the class as a function means to check the termination of the optimization inputs according to the implemented method.

Parameters:

  • nfev – Current number of cost function evaluations

  • parameters – Current optimization parameters

  • value – Current cost function value

  • stepsize – Step size for changing the optimization parameters

  • accepted – Bool flag if the optimization step is accepted by the used optimizer

Returns:

Bool flag if the optimization has terminated (converged).

__eq__(other) → bool¶

Method to compare two TerminationChecker objects. It compares class instance, name, values and buffer length.

Parameters:

other – Other class object that is compared with instace of this class

Returns:

Bool flag which is False if the two objects are not the same and True if they are the same.

__hash__ = None¶
__init__(buffer_length: int, name_str: str) → None¶
Parameters:

  • buffer_length – Integer number that determines the buffer length. The buffer contains the cost function values of previous optimization steps.

  • name_str – Unique name of the termination method that is used.

Raises:

ValueError – If the buffer length is not positive.

__weakref__¶

list of weak references to the object (if defined)

abstract _check_termination(nfev: int, parameters: Sequence[float], value: float, stepsize: int, accepted: bool) → bool¶

Define method to determine convergence of value

Returns:

Bool flag that is True if the optimization terminated (has converged) and False otherwise.

to_dict() → dict¶
Returns:

Deepcopy of the class properties as a dictionary.

qiskit_vqe_framework.TerminationChecker.get_termination_checker_from_name(checker_name: str, **kwargs) → TerminationChecker¶

Function to generate a termination checker class based on a unique name string.

Parameters:

  • checker_name – Unique name string of the termination checker method.

  • **kwargs – Input arguments for class initialization.

Raises:

  • ValueError – If required class input arguments are set to None.

  • ValueError – If unique name string is not matching any implemented termination checker method.

Returns:

Class implementation of the chosen termination checker method.
